intro: Odontites vernus, commonly known as the spring scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and white or pale blue, appearing in early spring. Odontites vernus is known for its delicate appearance and its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
